A

addBrowserAction(action) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the toolbar (outside of the URL bounding box) in display mode.
addNavigationAction(action) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Adds an action to be display on the far left side of the toolbar. This area is usually used on larger devices for navigation actions like "back" and "forward".
addPageAction(action) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the URL in display mode.

An action button to be added to the toolbar.

BrowserToolbar.ToggleButton - Class in mozilla.components.browser.toolbar

G

getBrowserActionMargin() - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Gets/Sets the margin to be used between browser actions.
getDisplaySiteSecurityIcon() - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Set/Get whether a site security icon (usually a lock or globe icon) should be next to the URL.
getHint() - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Sets the text to be displayed when the URL of the toolbar is empty.
getOnUrlClicked() - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Sets a lambda that will be invoked whenever the URL in display mode was clicked. Only if this lambda returns true the toolbar will switch to editing mode. Return false to not switch to editing mode and handle the click manually.
getUrl() - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
 
getUrlBoxMargin() - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Gets/Sets horizontal margin of the URL box (surrounding URL and page actions) in display mode.
getUrlBoxView() - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Gets/Sets a custom view that will be drawn as behind the URL and page actions in display mode.

I

invalidateActions() - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Declare that the actions (navigation actions, browser actions, page actions) have changed and should be updated if needed.

setBrowserActionMargin(value) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Gets/Sets the margin to be used between browser actions.
setDisplaySiteSecurityIcon(value) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar

setHint(value) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar

setMenuBuilder(menuBuilder) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Sets a BrowserMenuBuilder that will be used to create a menu when the menu button is clicked. The menu button will only be visible if a builder has been set.
setOnEditFocusChangeListener(listener) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Sets a listener to be invoked when focus of the URL input view (in edit mode) changed.
setOnUrlClicked(value) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Sets a lambda that will be invoked whenever the URL in display mode was clicked. Only if this lambda returns true the toolbar will switch to editing mode. Return false to not switch to editing mode and handle the click manually.

setUrlBoxView(value) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Gets/Sets a custom view that will be drawn as behind the URL and page actions in display mode.
setUrlTextPadding(left, top, right, bottom) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar
Sets the padding to be applied to the URL text (in display mode).

T

ToggleButton(imageResource, imageResourceSelected, contentDescription, contentDescriptionSelected, visible, selected, background, listener) - Constructor for class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar.ToggleButton
An action button with two states, selected and unselected. When the button is pressed, the state changes automatically.

U

updateUrl(url) - Method in class mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.edit.EditToolbar
Updates the URL. This should only be called if the toolbar is not in editing mode. Otherwise this might override the URL the user is currently typing.
